themes: Comparisons to other cities' artistic reputations
Critique of funding allocation based on organizational longevity
Call for investment in new institutions and venues
key_phrases: many longstanding organizations are low-performing, low-impact, and without much reputation/recognition
Austin isn't a more respected artistic city compared to Houston or Dallas
Rather than continuing to fund low-impact organizations just because they have been around for 20 years
put money toward new institutions and venues
the creation of a new artistic infrastructure for the city
barriers_identified: Continued funding of low-impact, longstanding organizations
Lack of recognition and reputation for Austin's arts scene
solutions_proposed: Redirect funding toward new institutions and venues
Create a new artistic infrastructure for the city
